P074181.project_name: Competitiveness and Employment Development Policy Loan (CEDPL)

keywords.cdata: accounting, accrual accounting, agriculture, AUDITING, Balance of Payments, bank privatization, Banking Regulation, banking sector, banking supervision, Bankruptcy, benchmarks, budget classification, budget institutions, Budget Law, budget reforms, budgetary Funds, budgetary practice, capital flows, capital inflows, CAPITAL MARKETS, cash basis, Central Bank, civil service, COMPETITIVENESS, conditionality, Consumer Price Index, Consumption Goods, currency appreciation, current account, current account deficit, DEBT, debt ratio, DEBT SUSTAINABILITY, Deposits, DEVELOPMENT POLICY, disinflation, dividends, domestic debt, domestic demand, domestic savings, economic activity, Economic Cooperation, economic growth, economic performance, economic policies, economic policy, economic power, Economic Reform, education reform, education system, emerging markets, Exchange Rate, exchange rate regime, exchange rates, Exchange Reserves, Expenditure, Expenditure rationalization, exports, external debt, external environment, external financing, financial markets, financial program, financial sector, Financial Sectors, financial statistics, fiscal adjustment, fiscal analysis, Fiscal consolidation, fiscal discipline, Fiscal performance, fiscal policies, fiscal policy, fiscal risks, fiscal stance, fiscal surplus, Foreign Exchange, Foreign Exchange Reserves, GDP, GNP, government securities, Gross Domestic Product, gross national product, Health Insurance, Health Insurance Fund, high debt, housing,

project_abstract.cdata: The development policy loan for Turkey supports legal, institutional, and structural reforms that promote growth and the creation of more and better jobs in Turkey by helping maintain the currently enabling macroeconomic framework; improve the investment climate - including a large program of privatization of state owned enterprises (SOEs), set the foundations for overhauling labor market regulations in the future, (d) increase access to investment capital, and promote the generation of knowledge and innovation, the adoption of new technologies, and upgrading the skills of the labor force.
